wikipedia_page.main: Charles Arthur Winter (24 December 1903 – 4 March 1982) was an English cricketer who played 26 first-class matches for Somerset County Cricket Club between 1921 and 1925.  A right-handed batsman, he scored 437 first-class runs for the county from the middle-to-lower order.  He also bowled occasionally for Somerset as a right-arm fast-medium bowler, claiming 15 wickets a bowling average of 38.13.
